intro: Strychnos merrillii, commonly known as the Philippine strychnos, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in lowland and montane forests, growing in shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
